Package entity

Class Enquiry

  • java.lang.Object
    • entity.Enquiry
  • public class Enquiry
extends java.lang.Object
    Entity class representing an enquiry in the BTO Management System. Enquiries are questions or requests for information submitted by applicants regarding specific BTO projects. Enquiries can be responded to by officers or managers, and their status is tracked through the system. This class provides methods for creating, managing, and searching enquiries in the system database.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Enquiry()
      Default constructor that initializes a new enquiry with current date, empty content, PENDING status, and generates a unique enquiry ID.
      Enquiry​(java.lang.String enquiryID, java.time.LocalDate dateTime, java.lang.String content, java.lang.String reply, java.time.LocalDate replyDate, Applicant submittedBy, Project project, EnquiryStatusEnum status, User respondent)
      Full constructor that initializes an enquiry with all properties.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Enquiry

        public Enquiry()
        Default constructor that initializes a new enquiry with current date, empty content, PENDING status, and generates a unique enquiry ID.

      • Enquiry

        public Enquiry​(java.lang.String enquiryID,
               java.time.LocalDate dateTime,
               java.lang.String content,
               java.lang.String reply,
               java.time.LocalDate replyDate,
               Applicant submittedBy,
               Project project,
               EnquiryStatusEnum status,
               User respondent)
        Full constructor that initializes an enquiry with all properties. If some parameters are null, default values are applied. The constructor also adds the enquiry to the applicant's record if provided.
        Parameters:
        enquiryID - Unique identifier for the enquiry, generated if null
        dateTime - Date and time when the enquiry was submitted
        content - Content or message of the enquiry
        reply - Response to the enquiry, null if not replied
        replyDate - Date when the enquiry was responded to
        submittedBy - Reference to the applicant who submitted the enquiry
        project - Reference to the project the enquiry is about
        status - Current status of the enquiry
        respondent - Reference to the user who responded to the enquiry

      • respond

        public boolean respond​(User user,
                       java.lang.String response)
        Records a response to this enquiry. Updates the reply, respondent, reply date, and status of the enquiry.
        Parameters:
        user - The User who is providing the response
        response - The text of the response
        Returns:
        boolean True if the response was successfully recorded, false otherwise
